headline: Street Optimism Builds Around Walmart Inc. (WMT)
summary: Walmart Inc. (NASDAQ:WMT) is among the best stocks in each sector in 2026. On February 20, TheFly reported that Bernstein lifted the price target on Walmart Inc. (NASDAQ:WMT) to $134, up from $129, and maintained an Outperform rating. The firm highlighted the company’s modest beat in the fourth quarter, while advising to buy the company’s shares […]

headline: Amazon Tops Walmart As Revenue Leader While AI Shift Reshapes Valuation Story
summary: Amazon.com (NasdaqGS:AMZN) has surpassed Walmart to become the largest U.S. company by annual revenue, taking the top spot on the Fortune 500. At the same time, AI research leader David Luan is departing, with Peter Desantis stepping in to oversee Amazon’s AI research efforts. These developments coincide with Amazon’s move to integrate its AGI division more closely with AWS. For investors watching Amazon.com at a share price of $210.63, this revenue milestone highlights how far the company...

headline: Walmart’s Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Walmart’s fourth quarter was marked by robust digital growth and continued market share gains, earning a positive reaction from investors. Management attributed the performance to a strong omnichannel strategy, as e-commerce sales grew 24% globally and new technology investments improved inventory and delivery speeds. headline: Walmart Leadership to Participate in Upcoming Investor Events

headline: New Market Force CX Study Shows Why Automotive Parts Retailers Struggle to Differentiate and What Experience Leaders Do Better
summary: Market Force Information®, a global leader in customer experience measurement and analytics, has released findings from its 2025 Automotive Parts CX Study, offering a clear view into a category where brand recognition alone is no longer enough to secure customer loyalty.

content.title: New Market Force CX Study Shows Why Automotive Parts Retailers Struggle to Differentiate and What Experience Leaders Do Better
content.summary: Market Force Information®, a global leader in customer experience measurement and analytics, has released findings from its 2025 Automotive Parts CX Study, offering a clear view into a category where brand recognition alone is no longer enough to secure customer loyalty.

thumbnail.caption: The Market Force 2025 Automotive Parts CX Study report shows brand-by-brand rankings across CX, loyalty, trust, and key drivers. Separate analyses for Vehicle Maintenance and Tires are also included.

headline: Sam’s Club revives shuttered activewear brand, offers lower prices
